item.title: 以色列与伊朗停火减少避险需求，黄金维持跌势
item.description: 由于伊朗和以色列之间不稳定的停火似乎得以维持，减少了避风港需求，中东紧张局势有所缓和，从而引发了黄金的下跌。【原文：Gold held a decline, which was triggered by a reduction in Middle East tensions as a shaky Iran-Israel ceasefire appeared to hold, cutting haven demand.】

item.title: 美联储施密德支持观望态度，关注价格数据
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）表示，美国央行应等待关税和其他政策对经济产生影响后再调整利率。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said the US central bank should wait to see how tariffs and other policies impact the economy before adjusting interest rates.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚大学调查网站中断后可能发生的网络攻击
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，哥伦比亚大学正在调查周二发生的大面积系统故障是否是这所常春藤盟校遭受网络攻击的结果。【原文：Columbia University is investigating whether a widespread system outage Tuesday was the result of a cyberattack on the Ivy League school, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 特朗普关税改变贸易格局，中国企业扩大对英出口
item.description: 中国公司正在加大对英国的发货量，达到多年来从未见过的水平，这可能表明这个亚洲工厂强国正在寻找出口市场，而不会受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）所征收的高关税的阻碍。【原文：Chinese companies are ramping up shipments to Britain to levels not seen in years, a possible sign that the Asian factory powerhouse is finding export markets unimpeded by high tariffs like those President Donald Trump has imposed.】

item.title: 中国债券买家期待套利交易提高回报率
item.description: 中国政府债券收益率几个月来一直横盘整理，但交易员们至少找到了一种提高收益的方法：套利。【原文：China’s government bond yields have been going sideways for months but traders have found at least one way to juice up returns: arbitrage.】

item.title: 高盛的钱伯斯认为货币对冲会加速美元下跌
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group）回购交易全球主管理查德-钱伯斯（Richard Chambers）表示，随着外国投资者加强货币对冲，美元可能会延续一年来最糟糕的开局。【原文：The dollar is likely to extend its worst start to a year as foreign investors boost their currency hedges, according to Richard Chambers, global head of repo-trading at Goldman Sachs Group.】

item.title: 中东停战持续，亚洲开盘谨慎市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市开盘谨慎，因为以色列和伊朗之间的休战似乎得以维持，而且美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔就降息前景发表了平衡的评论。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set for a cautious open as the Israel-Iran truce appeared to hold and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell gave balanced comments on prospects for rate cuts.】

item.title: 中国平安斥资 230 亿美元入股中资银行，押注股息分配
item.description: 中国平安保险集团股份有限公司和其他中国保险公司都加大了对中国最大银行的投资力度，赌红利收益率将超过利润率收窄和盈利压力带来的不利因素。【原文：Ping An Insurance Group Co., as well as other Chinese insurers, have ramped up investments in the nation’s biggest banks on a bet the dividend yields will outweigh headwinds of narrower margins and earnings pressure.】

item.title: 交易商评估停火协议，石油在连续两天暴跌后小幅走高
item.description: 由于交易商评估了伊朗-以色列停火以及一份显示美国原油库存再次下降的行业报告，石油走高，此前两天的跌幅达到两位数。【原文：Oil edged higher — after a double-digit percentage slump over two days — as traders assessed the Iran-Israel ceasefire and an industry report showing another drop in US crude stockpiles.】

item.title: 日本市场蓬勃发展，大和计划设立 6.9 亿美元的房地产基金
item.description: 大和证券集团公司（Daiwa Securities Group Inc.【原文：Daiwa Securities Group Inc. plans to launch a real estate fund with two partners, tapping investor demand for a piece of Japan’s booming property market.】

item.title: 香港开发商寻求以毕加索和沃霍尔艺术品为抵押的贷款
item.description: 香港的一个地产王朝成为了这座城市最多产的收藏家之一，它正在发现蓬勃发展的艺术品抵押贷款世界的局限性。【原文：A Hong Kong property dynasty that became one of the city’s most prolific collectors is discovering the limits of the burgeoning world of art-backed lending.】

item.title: 亿万富翁雅各布斯的 QXO 公司寻求出售 20 亿美元股份
item.description: 亿万富翁布拉德-雅各布斯（Brad Jacobs）领导的建筑产品分销商 QXO Inc.【原文：QXO Inc. is seeking to raise $2 billion in a share sale, as the building products distributor led by billionaire Brad Jacobs pursues a takeover.】

item.title: MSCI 在回顾中维持韩国的新兴市场地位
item.description: 摩根士丹利资本国际公司（MSCI Inc.【原文：South Korea’s bid for a developed-market status hit a setback after MSCI Inc. kept the country in the emerging-market category following a review, citing limited foreign exchange reforms and restricted availability of investment instruments.】

item.title: 摩根大通交易员被私人信贷市场拒之门外
item.description:
华尔街正在努力撬开这一炙手可热的资产类别，并为长期以来被他们拒之门外的紧握的贷款带来交易和透明度

。【原文：

Wall Street is struggling to pry open the red-hot asset class and bring trading and transparency to the tightly held loans that have long been off-limits to them

】

item.title: 日本政策负责人回击美国要求 5%国防开支的呼吁
item.description: 在特朗普政府呼吁美国盟国提高军费开支后，日本执政党政策负责人表示，日本应专注于提高国防能力，而不是追求开支目标。【原文：Japan should focus on enhancing its defense capabilities, not chasing spending goals, the ruling party’s policy chief said, following Trump administration calls for US allies to target higher military expenditure.】

item.title: Polymarket 将以 10 亿美元估值融资
item.description:
彼得-蒂尔的创始人基金主导了此次投资。【原文：

Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund is leading the investment. 

】

item.title: 债券交易员押注美国 10 年期债券收益率将跌至 4% 附近
item.description: 在美联储官员发表鸽派言论和中东紧张局势一触即发的背景下，交易员们正在加大期权赌注，认为 10 年期国债收益率有望跌至 4 月份以来的最低点。【原文：Traders are ramping up options wagers that 10-year Treasury yields are poised to sink to the lowest since April, amid dovish comments from Federal Reserve officials and a backdrop of simmering Mideast tensions.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔称预计关税将刺激通胀
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔表示，他预计关税将推动通胀上升，并表示支持对利率调整采取观望态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr said he anticipates tariffs will drive up inflation and expressed support for a wait-and-see approach to interest-rate adjustments.】

item.title: 新西兰金融科技公司 Xero 拟以 25 亿美元收购 Melio
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Xero Ltd. 正在考虑收购 Melio Payments Inc.【原文：Xero Ltd. is considering an acquisition of Melio Payments Inc. in a deal that could value it at more than $2.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Citadel Securities 寻求阻止 IEX 期权交易所的启动
item.description: Citadel Securities 要求美国证券交易委员会阻止一家由迈克尔-刘易斯（Michael Lewis）在 2014 年出版的《闪电男孩》（Flash Boys）一书中的明星创办的新交易所进入期权市场。【原文：Citadel Securities is asking the Securities and Exchange Commission to stop a new exchange founded by the stars of Michael Lewis’s 2014 book Flash Boys from entering the options market.】

item.title: 巴拉圭中央银行将基准利率维持在 6% 不变
item.description: 巴拉圭央行周二维持货币政策不变，将基准利率维持在 6% 不变。【原文：Paraguay’s central bank kept monetary policy on hold Tuesday, leaving the benchmark rate unchanged at 6%.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德的 "方舟 "在获得巨额收益后削减了 "方舟 "的股份
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）在最近的一次豪赌中大获成功，她正在缩减自己的投资组合：Circle Internet Group Inc.【原文：Cathie Wood is trimming her portfolio after scoring big with her latest bold bet: Circle Internet Group Inc., the stablecoin firm that has seen its shares surge by triple digits since its debut as a public company.】

item.title: 动荡蔓延，安杜兰对冲基金亏损加剧至 60
item.description: 对冲基金经理皮埃尔-安杜兰（Pierre Andurand）在 6 月份继续连败，因为地缘政治动荡令大宗商品市场动荡不安。【原文：Hedge fund manager Pierre Andurand’s losing streak continued in June as geopolitical turbulence unsettled commodity markets.】

item.title: 卡什卡利表示，美联储需要进一步明确关税对物价的影响
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，尽管近期通胀数据 "相当积极"，但美国央行在调整政策前仍需进一步明确关税将如何影响物价。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the US central bank needs more clarity on how tariffs will impact prices before adjusting policy, even as recent inflation data has been “quite positive.”】

item.title: 英国工业计划必须包括北海税收改革，集团称
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）称英国政府的十年工业战略是国家经济的 "转折点"，但对于石油和天然气游说团体来说，该计划必须包括对北海能源生产商的税收改革。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called his government’s 10-year industrial strategy “a turning point” for the nation’s economy, but for an oil and gas lobby the plan must include tax reform for North Sea energy producers.】

item.title: 地缘政治风险的真正体现
item.description:
石油市场的剧烈波动。【原文：

Wild swings in the oil market.

】

item.title: 石油交易员在暴跌前大举买入杠杆式看跌石油 ETF
item.description: 一种在油价下跌时获利的交易所交易产品有望创下自 2023 年以来的最大月度流入量，因为投资者正确地押注原油在冲突推动下的飙升将是短暂的。【原文：An exchange-traded product that profits when oil prices fall is on track for its biggest monthly inflow since 2023 as investors correctly wagered that crude’s conflict-driven spike would prove short-lived.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州高涨的房地产市场催生了小额债券违约
item.description: 加州湾区的住房市场变得如此昂贵，以至于威胁到当地一所特许学校的投资者。【原文：California’s Bay Area housing market has gotten so expensive, it’s threatening investors in a local charter school.】

item.title: 以下是鲍威尔在众议院作证的主要内容
item.description: 以下是美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周二在众议院金融服务委员会作证的主要内容：【原文：Here are the key takeaways from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s testimony before the House Financial Services Committee Tuesday:】

item.title: 麻省理工学院与贷款机构达成协议，借款最高可达 5 亿美元
item.description: 麻省理工学院达成了一项循环信贷协议，允许其一次借款高达 5 亿美元。【原文：The Massachusetts Institute of Technology cinched a revolving credit agreement that will allow it to borrow as much as $500 million at a time.】
